verses.verse: Furthermore Elihu<WH453> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559>
Hear<WH8085> my words,<WH4405> O you wise<WH2450> men; and give ear<WH238> to me, you that have knowledge.<WH3045>
For the ear<WH241> tries<WH974> words,<WH4405> as the mouth<WH2441> tastes<WH2938> meat.<WH398>
Let us choose<WH977> to us judgment:<WH4941> let us know<WH3045> among<WH996> ourselves what<WH4100> is good.<WH2896>
For Job<WH347> has said,<WH559> I am righteous:<WH6663> and God<WH410> has taken<WH5493> away<WH5493> my judgment.<WH4941>
Should I lie<WH3576> against<WH5921> my right?<WH4941> my wound<WH2671> is incurable<WH605> without<WH1097> transgression.<WH6588>
What<WH4310> man<WH1397> is like Job,<WH347> who drinks<WH8354> up scorning<WH3933> like water?<WH4325>
Which goes<WH732> in company<WH2274> with the workers<WH6466> of iniquity,<WH205> and walks<WH3212> with wicked<WH7562> men.<WH582>
For he has said,<WH559> It profits<WH5532> a man<WH1397> nothing<WH3808> that he should delight<WH7521> himself with God.<WH430>

Therefore<WH3651> listen<WH8085> to me you men<WH582> of understanding:<WH3824> far<WH2486> be it from God,<WH410> that he should do wickedness;<WH7562> and from the Almighty,<WH7706> that he should commit iniquity.<WH5766>
For the work<WH6467> of a man<WH120> shall he render<WH7999> to him, and cause every man<WH376> to find<WH4672> according to his ways.<WH734>
Yes,<WH637> surely<WH551> God<WH410> will not do wickedly,<WH7561> neither<WH3808> will the Almighty<WH7706> pervert<WH5791> judgment.<WH4941>
Who<WH4310> has given him a charge<WH6485> over the earth?<WH776> or who<WH4310> has disposed<WH7760> the whole<WH3605> world?<WH8398>
If<WH518> he set<WH7760> his heart<WH3820> on man, if he gather<WH622> to himself his spirit<WH7307> and his breath;<WH5397>
All<WH3605> flesh<WH1320> shall perish<WH1478> together,<WH3162> and man<WH120> shall turn<WH7725> again<WH7725> to dust.<WH6083>
If<WH518> now you have understanding,<WH998> hear<WH8085> this:<WH2063> listen<WH238> to the voice<WH6963> of my words.<WH4405>
Shall even<WH637> he that hates<WH8130> right<WH4941> govern?<WH2280> and will you condemn<WH7561> him that is most<WH3524> just?<WH6662>
Is it fit to say<WH559> to a king,<WH4428> You are wicked?<WH1100> and to princes,<WH5081> You are ungodly?<WH7563>

How<WH834> much less to him that accepts<WH5375> not the persons<WH6440> of princes,<WH8269> nor<WH3808> regards<WH5234> the rich<WH7771> more<WH6440> than<WH6440> the poor?<WH1800> for they all<WH3605> are the work<WH4639> of his hands.<WH3027>

In a moment<WH7281> shall they die,<WH4191> and the people<WH5971> shall be troubled<WH1607> at midnight,<WH2676> <WH3915> and pass<WH5674> away: and the mighty<WH47> shall be taken<WH5493> away<WH5493> without<WH3808> hand.<WH3027>
For his eyes<WH5869> are on the ways<WH1870> of man,<WH376> and he sees<WH7200> all<WH3605> his goings.<WH6806>
There is no<WH369> darkness,<WH2822> nor<WH369> shadow<WH6757> of death,<WH6757> where<WH8033> the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205> may hide<WH5641> themselves.
For he will not lay<WH7760> on man<WH376> more<WH5750> than right; that he should enter<WH1980> into judgment<WH4941> with God.<WH410>
He shall break<WH7489> in pieces mighty<WH3524> men without<WH3808> number,<WH2714> and set<WH5975> others<WH312> in their stead.<WH8478>
Therefore<WH3651> he knows<WH5234> their works,<WH4566> and he overturns<WH2015> them in the night,<WH3915> so that they are destroyed.<WH1792>
He strikes<WH5606> them as wicked<WH7563> men in the open<WH4725> sight<WH7200> of others;
Because<WH834> they turned<WH5493> back<WH5493> from him, and would not consider<WH7919> any<WH3605> of his ways:<WH1870>
So that they cause the cry<WH6818> of the poor<WH1800> to come<WH935> to him, and he hears<WH8085> the cry<WH6818> of the afflicted.<WH6041>

When he gives quietness,<WH8252> who<WH4310> then can make trouble?<WH7561> and when he hides<WH5641> his face,<WH6440> who<WH4310> then can behold<WH7789> him? whether it be done against<WH5921> a nation,<WH1471> or against<WH5921> a man<WH120> only:<WH3162>
That the hypocrite<WH120> <WH2611> reign<WH4427> not, lest the people<WH5971> be ensnared.<WH4170>
Surely<WH3588> it is meet to be said<WH559> to God,<WH410> I have borne<WH5375> chastisement, I will not offend<WH2254> any more:
That which I see<WH2372> not teach<WH3384> you me: if<WH518> I have done<WH6466> iniquity,<WH5766> I will do<WH6466> no<WH3808> more.

Should it be according to your mind?<WH5973> he will recompense<WH7999> it, whether<WH3588> you refuse,<WH3988> or whether<WH3588> you choose;<WH977> and not I: therefore speak<WH1696> what<WH4100> you know.<WH3045>
Let men<WH582> of understanding<WH3824> tell<WH559> me, and let a wise<WH2450> man<WH1397> listen<WH8085> to me.
Job<WH347> has spoken<WH1696> without<WH3808> knowledge,<WH1847> and his words<WH1697> were without<WH3808> wisdom.<WH7919>
My desire<WH15> is that Job<WH347> may be tried<WH974> to the end<WH5331> because<WH5921> of his answers<WH8666> for wicked<WH205> men.<WH582>
For he adds<WH3254> rebellion<WH6588> to his sin,<WH2403> he clapps<WH5606> his hands among<WH996> us, and multiplies<WH7235> his words<WH561> against God.<WH410>
